column2: Water put into public water supply by water service companies and water supply companies:  1995/6 to 2010/11
Copyright of data and/or information presented or attached in this document may not reside solely with this Department.
Environment Statistics Service, Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs, Area 6E Ergon House, 17 Smith Square, London SW1P 3JR, 08459 33 55 77

Since 2003 de-regulation of small abstractions set a threshold of 20 cubic metres per day as the value above which an abstraction licence will be required and now includes previously exempt activities such as dewatering, trickle irrigation and navigation within the licensing system. For further details see text.

column3: Water measured at point of delivery to premises
Unmetered water includes leakage from the distribution system and water used for miscellaneous purposes, such as firefighting,
sewer cleaning, water mains flushing and temporary supplies for construction sites.
